cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 395 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing north-northwest through the central Gulf, then expected to bend slightly west while approaching the southeast Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast near the Mouth of the Mississippi River (close to Metropolitan New Orleans)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City and including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River (hurricane) and Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border plus Lake Pontchartrain/Lake Maurepas/Metropolitan New Orleans (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coastline from Sabine Pass eastward through southeast Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely by early Monday, with a 32 % chance of sustained 50 kt (58 mph) winds and gusts near hurricane strength in the metro area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent tidal lakes, with 4–6 ft along the open coast from Morgan City to Ocean Springs.
weather_observation.rainfall: General 2–4 inches with locally up to 6 inches, producing areas of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado risk beginning early Monday; dangerous surf and rip currents along southeast Louisiana barrier islands.
